resources.string: Thank you for participating please leave your contact info. below
What do you think of Card Bidders?
What would you rate Card Bidders out of 100?

Welcome to Card Bidders 2021 The source for all your trading card Auctioning Needs. Use the buttons below to place a bid, view active bids, try out getting your fortune told just for fun, leave feedback on what you think of the app or check out more about the app through the About button or the menu. You are welcome to bid on any card as long as your bid is greater than the starting amount, but be aware the winner will be the person who places the highest bid so check back on Active Bids to see who has the top bid for a card.
Please use the form below to give us your impressions of Card Bidders 2021
Please only enter a whole dollar amount for your bid. When you want to place the bid click the button below. Warning all bids placed are final.
Pick What Type of Auctions You Would Like to View

Magic The Gathering first created in 1993 by Wizards of the Coast. A player in Magic takes the role of a Planeswalker, doing battle with other players as Planeswalkers by casting spells, using artifacts, and summoning creatures as depicted on individual cards drawn from their individual decks. The game was originally inspired by fantasy-roleplaying games like Dungeons & Dragons(Source Wikipedia)

Sports cards have been around since the 1860s originating with baseball cards, but they have now come to encompass all kinds of different sports including basketball, hockey, football, cricket and soccer.(Source Wikipedia)

Comic Book inspired trading cards have been around for decades drawing inspiration from many of the biggest comic book superhero names from Marvel,DC,Image,Black Horse and many other publishers.(Source Wikipedia)

Pokemon is based off of a popular Japanese video game from Nintendo. The first set of cards was released on October 20, 1996, containing 102 cards, with drawings by Ken Sugimori, Mitsuhiro Arita and Keiji Kinebuchi. The cards soon became very popular, and three years later in 1999, they were introduced to North America by Wizards of the Coast and shortly after the rest of the world.(Source Wikipedia)
